metadata.author: GHI Electronics
metadata.description: Simplified product schema with convention-based resource resolution

products.name: CincoBit
products.tagline: Ultra low-cost, micro:bit inspired, educational board
products.description: [Educators](/docs/educators) and [Makers](/docs/makers) will find great value in this ultra low-cost board. This is an excellent [micro:bit](/docs/hw/microbit) alternative, giving you alligator clip connections and DUELink [Downlink](/docs/interface/downlink) connector for [Daisylinking](/docs/engine/daisylink) modules.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `GetW()` | Get display width: 5. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 5. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 0. |
| `BtnA()` | Returns 1 if button A is pressed. |
| `BtnB()` | Returns 1 if button B is pressed. |
| `IsTouch(p)` | Returns 1 if `p` pad (0, 1, or 2) is touched. |
| `Buzzer(f,d)` | Plays buzzer to `f` frequency(50 to 15K) for `d` duration in milliseconds. |
| `Light()` | Returns voltage from light sensor. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

:::tip
See [Graphics](/docs/engine/graphics) for available drawing functions.
:::

products.name: ClipIt
products.description:
[Educators](/docs/educators) can now elevate their STEM-mission with Clipit. Start immediately with light sensor and touch pads to read inputs. Then use any of the supported [Languages](/docs/language/intro) to process those inputs and then control the output on the 5x5 LED matrix and buzzer.

Go beyond and add alligator clips for reading touch from objects, or control other circuits.

Of course, this is a DUELink board and [Downlink](/docs/interface/downlink) is ready for [Daisylinking](/docs/engine/daisylink) all of your modules.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `TouchA()` | Returns 1 if A pad is touched. |
| `TouchB()` | Returns 1 if B pad is touched. |
| `TouchUp()` | Returns 1 if Up pad is touched. |
| `TouchDown()` | Returns 1 if Down pad is touched. |
| `TouchLeft()` | Returns 1 if Left pad is touched. |
| `TouchRight()` | Returns 1 if Right pad is touched. |
| `Buzzer(f,d)` | Plays buzzer to `f` frequency(50 to 15K) for `d` duration in milliseconds. |
| `Light()` | Returns voltage level from light sensor. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: DueDuino
products.tagline: Arduino form factor inspired DUELink mainboard
products.description:
Use the official DUELink engine firmware or use the [Arduino](/docs/hw/arduino) software IDE to program DueDuino.

Of course, this is a DUELink board and [Downlink](/docs/interface/downlink) connector is ready for [Daisylinking](/docs/engine/daisylink) all of your modules.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `BtnLdr()` | Returns 1 if LDR button is pressed. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: DueSTEM
products.description:
`Input -> Process -> Output` is how DueSTEM brings everything [educators](/docs/educators) need to demonstrate physical computing. There are 4 inputs and 4 outputs. The graphical display can be used to show sensor levels or for building games!

Extend the board with sensors and actuators on the female pin-header and the [Downlink](/docs/interface/downlink) connector.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `GetW()` | Get display width: 128. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 64. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 0. |
| `BtnPin(a)` | Returns button's pin number, based on `a` alias ('U' = Up, 'D' = Down, 'L' = Left, 'R' = Right) |
| `GetX()` | Returns the X axis of the Accelerometer. |
| `GetY()` | Returns the Y axis of the Accelerometer. |
| `GetZ()` | Returns the Z axis of the Accelerometer. |
| `SetBulb(c)` | Sets Lightbulb `c` color with 24bit RGB color (RRGGBB). |
| `Tunes(f,d)` | Plays Tunes buzzer to `f` frequency(50 to 15K) for `d` duration in milliseconds. |
| `Light()` | Returns voltage level from Light sensor. |
| `ReadTemp()` | Returns voltage level from Temperature sensor. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: PixoBit
products.tagline: micro:bit Form Factor with 128x64 OLED 0.96" Display
products.description: PixoBit upgrades [CincoBit](/docs/products/mccincobit-e) with a graphical display. You can now show sensor data or build video games!
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `GetW()` | Get display width: 128. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 64. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 0. |
| `BtnUpA()` | Returns 1 if button A was released. |
| `BtnDownA()` | Returns 1 if button A was pressed. |
| `BtnUpB()` | Returns 1 if button B was released. |
| `BtnDownB()` | Returns 1 if button B was pressed. |
| `IsTouch(p)` | Returns 1 if `p` pad (0, 1, or 2) is touched. |
| `Buzzer(f,d)` | Play buzzer with `f` frequency and `d` duration in milliseconds. This is blocking function. |
| `Light()` | Returns voltage from light sensor. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Stamp
products.tagline: Seeed Xiao Form Factor DUELink Microcomputer
products.description:
This fingertip-sized tiny board is as capable as any other DUELink module. Plug it in a breadboard using male headers, or solder it directly using the edge pads. It has a Seeed Xiao compatible footprint as well. It includes an upgraded regulator allowing for connecting many DUELink modules on the [Downlink](/docs/interface/downlink) connector.

This is a great choice to help you in making your own DUELink modules. Don't want USB? Then consider using [Stick](/docs/products/mcstick-a).
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `BtnLdr()` | Returns 1 if LDR button is pressed. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Stick
products.tagline: DIP24 Form Factor SMT DUELink SoM
products.description:
Start making your own DUELink modules using this Surface-Mountable DUELink SoM that is also DIP24 form-factor.

Both U and D connectors are included. The USB connections are also exposed if you want to add a USB connector, such as Stamp (for tiny board with USB).
products.Notes: Connect Ghizzy Jr leg to USB port directly.

products.name: Ghizzy Jr
products.description:
Thinking about an exciting give-away for your next event customized with your logo?  This is Ghizzy Jr, quite possibly the smallest, cutest, and smartest keychain in the world! This mini robot-shaped pocket-sized microcomputer plugs right into a USB socket and is a programmable board with endless possibilities, thanks to its [Downlink](/docs/interface/downlink) connector. Start by controlling the full-color eyes and then start [daiylinking](/docs/engine/daisylink) any of the DUELink modules!

 Ghizzy can be commanded from one of the many supported [Coding Languages](/docs/language/intro), and it can run stand alone using [MicroBlocks](/docs/language/microblocks).

![custom logo](pathname:///img/ghizzy-jr-logo.png)

Ghizzy Jr is only available as a special order,  **customized with your artwork**. There is a minimum order of 500 pieces and 4-weeks lead-time. Please [Contact us](https://www.ghielectronics.com/contact/) for more information.

:::note

 The "legs" are a standard USB connector but a printed circuit. This works great on 99% of devices with a possible rare failure.

:::
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Eye(l,r)` | Sets the `l` left and `r` right "Eyes" with 24bit RGB color (RRGGBB). |
| `BtnLdr()` | Returns 1 if LDR button is pressed. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |
products.Notes: Connect Ghizzy Jr leg to USB port directly

products.name: Ghizzy
products.description:
Tiny robot-shaped circuits with LEDs, buzzer, buttons, and CR2032 battery holder.

:::note

 The "legs" are a standard USB connector but a printed circuit. This works great on 99% of devices with a possible rare failure.

:::
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Eye(l,r)` | Sets the `l` left and `r` right "Eyes" with 24bit RGB color (RRGGBB). |
| `Ear(l,r)` | Activate the `l` left and `r` "ears" LEDs (1 on, 0 off). |
| `Mouth(o)` | Activate the `m` "mouth" LED (1 on, 0 off). |
| `BtnLdr()` | Returns 1 if LDR button is pressed. |
| `Buzzer(f,d)` | Plays buzzer to `f` frequency(50 to 15K) for `d` duration in milliseconds. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Holiday Tree
products.description: This is arguably the smartest holiday tree in the world! Control the LEDs in Standalone mode or connect to a host and control the tree from one of the many supported languages and devices. The 2 boards (A and B) slide into each other, turning this into a 3D-ish module!
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `PlayLED(enable)` | `PlayLED(1)` will make the LED constantly blink, default. Use `PlayLED(0)` to disable playback and manually control the LEDs. |
| `SetLED(i, c, l)` | Sets a specific LED, `i` index (index start from 1), to a `c` color (hex value), `l` brightness (0 off, max 31). |
| `SetAll(color)` | Sets all LEDs to a specific color, use 0 to turn off. |
| `ShowLed()` | Flush Leds, and show. |
| `RndLed()` | Show random color on random leds. |
| `Buzzer(f,d)` | Play buzzer with `f` frequency and `d` duration in milliseconds. This is blocking function. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Chrono
products.description:
Scroll text on the LED matrix or use the sides to show "time"! Chrono includes two buttons and a CR2032 battery holder.

 Add a a wrist band or a lanyard to turn this into a "wearable" module.
keyFeatures: Slotted ends for wristband or mounting
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SetLED(i,s)` | Set specific LED to on or off |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: ePaper M29
products.description: e-Ink (ePaper) displays only need power to update the screen. But then power can be disconnected and the display will retain the graphics with zero power requirements.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Width()` | Display width. |
| `Height()` | Display Height. |
| `DrawOnBW()` | Next drawing functions will go on B&W. |
| `DrawOnRed()` | Next drawing functions will go on Red. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: ePaper M42
products.description:
e-Ink (ePaper) displays only need power to update the screen. But then power can be disconnected and the display will retain the graphics with zero power requirements.

This display works via the graphics internal services with 2x pixel multiplier, giving the user 200x150 pixels.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Width()` | Display width. |
| `Height()` | Display Height. |
| `DrawOnBW()` | Next drawing functions will go on B&W. |
| `DrawOnRed()` | Next drawing functions will go on Red. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: HDMI
products.description:
Add HDMI graphics to any [Supported Hardware](/docs/hw/intro). The board has its own graphics processor and memory. Your system will only need to issue simple commands to show graphics on a 90" TV screen!

The module uses [BT817Q](https://brtchip.com/product/bt817q/). Drawing with this module will be done via the graphics coprocessor and not the internal graphics engine.
keyFeatures: Graphics coprocessor drawing (not internal graphics engine)
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Synth(i, s)` | Synthesize a note using built in instruments at index `i` with `s` start. |
| `DLClear()` | Clear the commands. |
| `DLCmd(c, {...})` | Add a drawing `c` command with `{...}` arguments. |
| `DLSwap()` | Execute the graphics commands and swap working buffers. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LCD 16x2
products.description: Print up to 16 characters over 2 rows on this character display.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Home()` | Send cursor home. |
| `Clr()` | Clear the display. |
| `CPos(c,r)` | Sets the cursor position at `c` column and `r` row. |
| `CPrint(c)` | Print an ASCII `c` character. |
| `CPrintS(str)` | Print a string. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LCD 20x4
products.description: Print up to 20 characters over 4 rows on this character display.

| `Clr()` | Clear the display. |
| `CPos(c,r)` | Sets the cursor position at `c` column and `r` row. |
| `CPrint(c)` | Print an ASCII `c` character. |
| `CPrintS(str)` | Print a string. |

products.name: OLED 096
products.description: This small 0.96" display is very sharp due to its OLED construction. It is B&W color, but with 128x64 pixels, it has enough resolution to show plenty of data and [graphics](/docs/engine/graphics).

| `IsColor()` | Returns 0. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Portal CP70
products.tagline: 7" 800x400 Color Touch Display with Graphics Co-Processor
products.description: Portal CP70 7" 800x400 capacitive touch display with a graphics co-processor [BT817Q](https://brtchip.com/product/bt817q/). Drawing using this module will be done via the graphics coprocessor and not the internal graphics engine.
products.driverApi:

| `Synth(i, s)` | Synthesize a note using built in instruments at index `i` with `s` start. |
| `DLClear()` | Clear the commands. |
| `DLCmd(c, {...})` | Add a drawing `c` command with `{...}` arguments. |
| `DLSwap()` | Execute the graphics commands and swap working buffers. |

products.name: TFT CP23
products.description: 2.3" 320x240 color TFT display with capacitive touch screen, supporting [Graphics](/docs/engine/graphics) in buffered and in direct modes.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init(m,o)` | Initialize display `m` mode (buffered = 0 , direct = 1). `o` orientation (landscape = 0, portrait = 1). Init(0, 0) automatically called on power-up. |
| `GetW()` | Get display width: 106 in buffered, 320 in direct. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 80 in buffered, 240 in direct. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 1. |
| `TouchX()` | Returns touch x. |
| `TouchY()` | Returns touch y. |
| `SetDACtrl(s,r,c,b)` | Data access control `s` swapRowCol, `r` invertRow, `c` invertCol, `b` swapBGRSet data access control. |
| `SetWindow(x,y,w,h)` | Sets draw window `x` display's x value, `y` display's y value., `w` display's width value, `h` display's height value. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: TFT N18
products.description: 1.8" - 160x128 Color TFT LCD (no touch) display, supporting [Graphics](/docs/engine/graphics).
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|

| `GetW()` | Get display width: 64 in buffered, 128 in direct. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 80 in buffered, 160 in direct. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 1. |
| `TouchX()` | Returns touch x. |
| `TouchY()` | Returns touch y. |
| `SetDACtrl(s,r,c,b)` | Data access control `s` swapRowCol, `r` invertRow, `c` invertCol, `b` swapBGRSet data access control. |
| `SetWindow(x,y,w,h)` | Sets draw window `x` display's x value, `y` display's y value., `w` display's width value, `h` display's height value. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: TFT R128
products.description: 1.28" - 240x240 Color TFT LCD round (no touch) display, supporting [Graphics](/docs/engine/graphics).
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init(m)` | Initialize the display. Automatically called on power up `m`mode to (1-direct, 0-buffered (default)). |
| `GetW()` | Get display width: 80 in buffered, 240 in direct. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 80 in buffered, 240 in direct. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 1. |
| `TouchX()` | Returns touch x. |
| `TouchY()` | Returns touch y. |

products.name: VFD B8
products.description: Vacuum fluorescent displays are visually pleasing. This 8x character display looks great at any time, but it will look especially amazing in the dark!
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `CPrint(x, c)` | Print an ASCII `c` character at `x` pos. |
| `CPrintS(str)` | Print a string. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Fan
products.description: This smart DUELink fan has speed and direction control.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Fan(s)` | Sets fan `s` speed (-100 to 100). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Load
products.description: The Load module is designed to control up to 8 actuators. No soldering is necessary as all connections are found on a screw terminal block.

products.name: MotoMax
products.description: This heavy-duty single motor controller has some serious driving power with up to 27V and 43A!
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SMotor(s)` | Sets the motor `s` speed and direction (-100 to 100). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: MotoTwin
products.description: This dual motor controller is capable of driving 2 motors at 1A each, with up to 18V from two screw terminal block.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SMotorA(s)` | Sets Motor A `s` speed and direction (-100 to 100). |
| `SMotorB(s)` | Sets Motor B `s` speed and direction (-100 to 100). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Relay P16
products.description: When it comes to power isolation, this module comes in perfectly handy. The relays are optically-isolated from the rest of the circuit. The 16x relays are capable of up to 10A @ 250V each. The relays are powered from a 12V barrel-jack power source.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Sets(i, v)` | Sets a relay at `i` index to `v` value (1 on, 0 off). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Relay P4
products.description: Control high current loads using these 4x mechanical relays. Each relay is capable of driving up to 1A at 250V. The relays are powered from a 5V barrel-jack power source.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Sets(i, v)` | Sets a relay at `i` index to `v` value (1 on, 0 off). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Relay X1
products.description: This single mechanical relay controller is self-powered, right from the DUELink bus. It is capable of 10A @ 250V.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Sets(v)` | Activate the relay (1 on, 0 off). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Servo P8
products.description: Control up to 8x servo motors. Daisylink multiple Servo-P8 for controlling hundreds of servo motors!

products.name: Servo X1
products.description: This DUELink 9G micro servo has everything in a single package. The motor uses power right from the DUELink bus, where it is being controlled as well.

products.name: StepPulse
products.description: This module will generate the signal (pulses) necessary to drive stepper motor controllers. There is a wide range of available controllers, including nicely isolated ones.

products.name: StepDrive P1
products.description: This module utilizes the very common stepper motor drivers commonly used in Arduino CNC Shield. They are available in multiple models. We include a driver capable of 30V @ 1A, but you can easily swap it with your favorite driver if desired.

products.name: StepDrive P3
products.description: This module utilizes the very common stepper motor drivers commonly used in Arduino CNC Shield. They are available in multiple models. We include drivers capable of 30V @ 1A each, but you can easily swap them with your favorite driver if desired.

products.name: CAN
products.description: CAN bus interface module for automotive and industrial networks
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Bitrate(b)` | Sets the `b` bitrate (125K, 250K, 500K, 1M) |
| `RxFull()` | Returns 1 if there is a received CAN message. |
| `RxRd()` | Reads a received message. Returns the ArbID of the message or -1 if none. `b9` is a 9-byte array contains the message body, with first element containing DLC followed by 0 to 8 bytes of data. |
| `TxFree()` | Returns 1 if ready for new data, or previous transmit request succeeded. |
| `TxReq(i,l,b9)` | Request to send a message with `i` EID and `l` length of the `b9` data array. Returns 1 if a message was posted or 0 if busy to take a new one. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: DMX
products.description:
Control hundreds of DMX stage motors and lights using this controller.

![DMX Light](pathname:///img/dmx-light.jpg)

Not only that, this module can also read DMX controllers. You can now have a commercial grade controller in your project.

![DMX Controller](pathname:///img/dmx-controller.jpg)
products.driverApi:
:::tip
DMX module uses the [Standard Library](../engine/stdlib) DMX bus. No other drivers are needed.
:::

products.name: Ethernet
products.description: Ethernet connectivity module for network communications

products.name: RS485
products.description:
Connect and control any industrial-grade low-cost electrically-isolated RS485 Sensors and Actuators with ease. Here is an example analog input.

![RS485 Analog Input](pathname:///img/rs485-ain.jpg)

products.name: Serial USB
products.description: A virtual serial connection (COM port) is presented by this module. An application can send serial data to a computer over a USB connection.

products.name: USB Host
products.description: USB host controller for connecting USB peripherals

products.name: BTN AR100
products.description: This large 100mm Red arcade button has an internal light and can take serious punches! We also added 3x RGB LEDs around it for some exciting light shows!
products.driverApi:

| `SetRing(i,r,g,b)` | Sets LED at `i` index to `r`, `g`, `b` color (0 to 100). |
| `SetCtr(v)` | Sets the large button LED to `v` value(1 on, 0 off). |
| `BtnPin()` | Returns the button pin number. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: BTN RGB28x4
products.description: These four 28mm buttons are transparent white on the outside but are backlit with RGB LEDs. There are 7 possible color combinations, plus off!
products.driverApi:

| `BtnA()` | Returns 1 if button A is pressed. |
| `BtnB()` | Returns 1 if button B is pressed. |
| `BtnC()` | Returns 1 if button C is pressed. |
| `BtnD()` | Returns 1 if button D is pressed. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.driverApi:

products.name: Button L7

products.name: Button S
products.description: This module offers a small "squishy" 5x5mm tactile button.

products.name: Dial

products.name: DipSwitch
products.description: Use these 10x DIP switches as you wish, usually for config, in your project.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Read(i)` | read `i` index value from switch returns 0=Off, 1=On. |

products.name: Fingerprint
products.description: Read and match prerecorded fingerprints with this intelligent HMI sensor.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `GetSavedCnt()` | Returns how many fingerprint model are saved. |
| `DelModel(l)` | Deletes model at `l` location. |
| `StoreModel(l)` | Stores a converted model at `l` location. |
| `TakeImg()` | Captures a fingerprint image. Returns 0 if succeeded. |
| `ConvertImg(s)` | Converts captured image and stores it in `s` slot (1 or 2). |
| `FastSearch()` | Searches the internal database for a converted image. |
| `SetLed(c,b,k)` | Sets the LED to `c` color (1 red, 2 blue, 3 purple), with `b` blink(0 always on, 1 blink), with `k` count (0 is forever!). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Flash
products.description: Add 16MB of flash storage to any project. Create your own file management system or use the provided sector read/write methods.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SfGetid(b9)` | Returns 3 bytes in `b9` |
| `SfErase(a)` | Erases a block at `a` address. |
| `SfWrite(a,b9)` | Writes a byte array `b9` at `a` address. |
| `SfRead(a,b9)` | Reads a byte array from flash at `a` address. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: SD Card
products.description:
Access files on SD cards. Full file system facilities are provided, see [File System](/docs/engine/filesystem).

:::tip
[USB Host](/docs/products/cmusbhost-b) can be used to access files on USB memory devices.
:::

products.name: MicroSD
products.description:
Access files on micro SD cards. Full file system facilities are provided, see [File System](/docs/engine/filesystem).

:::tip
[USB Host](/docs/products/cmusbhost-b) can be used to access files on USB memory devices.
:::

products.name: GNSS WA
products.description: This Global Navigation Satellite System (GPS, Galileo, GLONASS) module has a built-in antenna. Consider [this GNSS](/docs/products/wlgnss-b) module if you want to add your own antenna.

products.name: GNSS
products.tagline: GNSS Positioning Module with uFL Connector
products.description: This Global Navigation Satellite System (GPS, Galileo, GLONASS) module with uFL connector for external antenna. The required antenna is not included, giving the user the choice to select the right antenna. Consider [this GNSS](/docs/products/wlgnsswa-a) with built-in antenna.

products.name: Infrared
products.description: Use light, infrared to be exact, to send and receive data. The data is transferred over a 38Khz frequency to filter out any other surrounding infrared light.

products.name: NRF24 Max
products.tagline: Wireless NRF24 Transceiver with Amplified Antenna
products.description: Send and receive data wirelessly using SMA 2.4Ghz. The PA+LNA gives this module a coverage of up to a 1000 meters!. Min version [available](./wlnrf24min-c).

products.name: NRF24 Min
products.description: Send and receive data wirelessly using SMA 2.4Ghz. This module uses a simple PCB antenna. Consider [NRF24 Max](./wlnrf24max-c) for a higher coverage.!

products.name: RFID
products.description: Read RFID (Radio-Frequency IDentification) unique IDs from tags and access cards. The module includes tags, but any other standard tags should work.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `isCard()` | Returns 1 if a new card is detected. |
| `ReadCard(a1)` | read the new card in a 16byte array. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Accel
products.description: This 3-axis accelerometer can be used to detect motion, tilt, and acceleration just to name a few.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `GetX()` | Returns X value. |
| `GetY()` | Returns Y value. |
| `GetZ()` | Returns Z value. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: AirQuality
products.description: This multi-gas digital sensor is used to detect surrounding air quality.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `AhtTemp()` | Returns ambient temperature in celsius. |
| `AhtHumid()` | Returns relative humidity. |
| `EnsAqi()` | Returns air quality index. |
| `EnsTvoc()` | Returns Total Volatile Organic Compounds. |
| `EnsEco2()` | Returns equivalent CO2. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Barometer
products.description: This barometric pressure sensor also includes temperature and humidity measurements.

products.name: ClipSense
products.description:
With these alligator-clip-friendly pads, users can easily connect(clip) anything that requires digital inputs/outputs. These pads also support analog and PWM (analog out) functionality.

The pads also support capacitive sensing to detect touch from a connected object.

products.name: Current
products.description: Connect the terminal block inline of AC or DC power to measure its current. The sensor has an internal resistance of 1.2 milli-ohm. It is capable of measuring up to 12.5A.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Current()` | Reads the current flow level in Amps. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Distance
products.description: This sensor sends an ultrasonic chirp, then it measures the time it takes for the sound to bounce back. The time it takes maps to the distance between the sensor and the object it's facing.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Distance()` | Reads the current distance in cm. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: DOF9
products.description: This 9DoF (Degrees of Freedom) MEMS (Micro Electro Mechanical System) sensor includes 3axis accelerometer, 3axis gyro, & 3axis magnetometer. The combination of these inputs can be used to get exact tilt and orientation.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `RAccel()` | Reads the acceleration XYZ in `_x`, `_y`, `_Z` variables. |
| `RCompass()` | Reads the compass XYZ in `_x`, `_y`, `_Z` variables. |
| `RGyro()` | Reads the gyro XYZ and its internal temp in `_x`, `_y`, `_Z`, `_T` variables. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: EKG
products.description: Use this module to experiment with heart EKG signals. This is NOT a medical device but an educational sensor for experimentation. The kit includes probes and sticker pads.

products.name: Gas
products.description: This gas sensor ships with MQ-7 (carbon monoxide) installed. However, the module uses a socket allowing the sensor be be easily swapped with other gas sensors, like MQ-3 alcohol gas sensor.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Heater(s)` | Sets the heater `s` state (1 on, 0 off). |
| `Read()` | Reads the current voltage level in Volts. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Light
products.description: A good sensor for detecting daytime or when lights are turned on. This is not an accurate light level sensor, but provides overall ambient light levels.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Light()` | Returns value from 0 to 100. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Motion
products.description: PIR (Passive Infrared) motion sensors use light in its view to detect motion.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Detect()` | Returns 1 if motion is detected. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Pressure
products.description: Connect this sensor to your instrument using a tiny pipe to measure water/liquid pressure. Different ranges are available.
products.driverApi:
:::tip
No Driver! Use the [Standard Library API](/docs/engine/stdlib) VRead(2) directly.
:::

products.name: RTC
products.description: This module is a RTC (Real Time Clock) "time sensor" with a backup battery to keep time running even when the system is powered off.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SetTime(y,n,d,h,m,s)` | Sets date/time to `y` year, `n` month, `d` day, `h` hour, `m` minute, and `s` second. |
| `GetTime()` | Returns current time in \_y, \_n, \_d, \_h, \_m, \_s variables. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Temperature & Humidity
products.description: Measure temperature with +-0.5 degree of accuracy at 0.1 celsius resolution. The humidity sensor is +=2RH% accurate with a resolution of 0.1%RH.
products.driverApi:
:::tip
Use the Standard Library API directly to read temp and humidity.
:::

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Temp()` | Returns temperature in celsius. |
| `Humid()` | Returns relative humidity percentage. |
| `SenPin()` | Returns the sensor's pin number. |
| `SenType()` | Returns the sensor's type. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: TempRTD
products.description: This sensor uses the included RTD (Resistance Temperature Detector) to measure temperatures. It includes RTD PT100 probe
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `ReadTemp()` | Reads the current temperature in celsius. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED MT1208
products.description: Use these 96 dazzling LEDs to show text, create flashy games, or run whatever effect you desire. You will be surprised with how much you can do with a 12x8 LED matrix!
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init()` | Initialize the module. Automatically called on power up. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED R16
products.description: A ring with 16 LEDs.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SetLed(l, v)` | Sets Led at `l` (1 to 16) to a `v` value (1 on, 0 off). |
| `LedOff()` | Resets all leds to off. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED RGB3
products.description: A visual LED with 3x RGB LEDs. These lights can be set to any of 7 colors or can be turned off.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SetLed(i, c)` | sets an LED at `i` (0 to 3) to `c` (RRGGBB color). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED S284
products.description:
These 0.28" 4-digit 7-segment displays come in two types: a counter with decimal point, and timer with a colon in the middle.

![Count and Time](/img/led-7seg-time-count.png)
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init()` | Initialize the module. Automatically called on power up. |
| `Digit(n)` | Draw `n` number to LEDs. |
| `Seg7(i, s)` | Draw a single `s` digit (0 to 9) on `i` digit. |
| `Dot(i, v)` | Draw a dot at `i` index with `v` value (0 off 1 on) on count-type LED. |
| `Colon(n)` | Show colon on time-type LED. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED S404
products.description:
These 0.40" 4-digit 7-segment displays come in two types: a counter with decimal point, and timer with a colon in the middle.

![Count and Time](/img/led-7seg-time-count.png)
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init()` | Initialize the module. Automatically called on power up. |
| `Digit(n)` | Draw `n` number to LEDs. |
| `Seg7(i, s)` | Draw a single `s` digit (0 to 9) on `i` digit. |
| `Dot(i, v)` | Draw a dot at `i` index with `v` value (0 off 1 on) on count-type LED. |
| `Colon(n)` | Show colon on time-type LED. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED S564
products.description:
These 0.56" 4-digit 7-segment displays come in two types: a counter with decimal point, and timer with a colon in the middle.

![Count and Time](/img/led-7seg-time-count.png)
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init()` | Initialize the module. Automatically called on power up. |
| `Digit(n)` | Draw `n` number to LEDs. |
| `Seg7(i, s)` | Draw a single `s` digit (0 to 9) on `i` digit. |
| `Dot(i, v)` | Draw a dot at `i` index with `v` value (0 off 1 on) on count-type LED. |
| `Colon(n)` | Show colon on time-type LED. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: LED SS805
products.description: 16-segment displays ar good to display alpha-numerical info. This 0.80 is a decent size to be visible from a few feet.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Init()` | Initialize the module. Automatically called on power up. |
| `Seg16(i, s)` | Draw a single `s` character (0 to 9) on `i` digit (from the right). |
| `Digit(n)` | Draw 'n' number to LEDs. |
| `PrntChr(i, c)` | Print an ascii `c` character (A to Z and 0 to 9) at `i` index (from the left). |
| `PrntStr(b1)` | Print a string of ascii characters. |
| `Dot(i, v)` | Draw dot at `i` index with `v` value (0 off, 1 on). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Smart LED
products.description: The DUELink standard library includes support for WS2811 smart LEDs. When using matrices, the support is even included with the graphics function.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `WS2811()` | Returns the pin number used for DAT pin to be used with `WS2811` Smart LED [Graphics](/docs/engine/graphics). |
| `IntAPA(c)` | Get the system ready for `APA102C`. |
| `SetAPA(i, c, l)` | Sets the color at `i` index to `c` color (RRGGBB) and `l` luminance (0 to 31). |
| `ShwAPA()` | Show/update the actual LEDs with preassigned colors. |
| `IntLPD(c)` | Get the system ready for `LPD8806`. |
| `SetLPD(i, c)` | Sets the color at `i` index to `c` color (RRGGBB) |
| `ShwLPD()` | Show/update the actual LEDs with preassigned colors. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Buzzer
products.description: Use this peizo buzzer to generate tones and simple melodies. Sound an alarm, play a melody when a task is finished or even generate noises!
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `PlayBeep(f, d)` | Play beep, (f: frequency, d: duration in ms). |
| `PlaySound(f, d, c)` | Play sound, (f: frequency, d: duration in ms, c: duty cycle). |
| `PlayMelody(a1)` | Play melody. `a1` is a float array, (odd elements: frequency, even elements: duration). |
| `StopMelody()` | Stop melody. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: MP3
products.description:
Play MP3 audio/music from files found on the attached Micro SD card. The audio quality is reasonable and single mono channel. There is no system load as the module only receives and processes simple commands, like `start` playing, or `stop`. The files on the Micro SD card are saved in standard FAT16/FAT32 file system and can handle SD cards up to 32GB. Note that you will not have access to the files directly. Only the MP3 decoder can read the files. You will need to move the Micro SD card to a PC to load it with MP3 files.

Micro SD card is required and is not included.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SendCmd(c, a)` | Send `c` command & `a` argument to mp3 module. |
| `WResponse(t, c, a)` | `t` timeout, `c` code, `a` argument. Wait for response. |
| `Stop()` | Stop playing. |
| `SetVol(v)` | Sets `v` volume. (Min 0, max 30) |
| `IsBusy()` | Returns 1 if busy. |
| `Loop(r)` | Sets `r` repeat. |
| `Rst()` | Reset mp3 module. |
| `PlayFile(f, d)` | Play file. `f` Files and `d` directories must be named in numerics. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Radio FM
products.description: Use simple commands to set the channel and audio level on this FM Radio Receiver. The module includes a standard 3.5mm stereo audio plug, for connecting headphones or amplified speakers.

products.name: Spectrum
products.description: This module breaks down the incoming audio into 63Hz, 160Hz, 400Hz, 1Khz, 2.5Khz, 6.25Khz, 16Khz. It then measures the audio level at these frequencies.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `UpdBnd()` | Update all 7 bands. Values are stored in `a1[]` array (0 to 100). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Barcode L1D2D
products.description:
This camera can capture and decode different barcodes.

1D Formats: EAN-13, EAN-8, UPC-A, UPC-E ISSN, ISBN, CodaBar,Code 128, Code93, ITF-14, ITF-6, Interleaved 2 of 5, Industrial 2 of 5, Matrix 2 of 5, Code 39,Code 11, MSI-Plessey, GS1 Composite,GS1-Databar (RSS)
2D Formats: QR Code, Data Matrix, PDF417
Scanning angle: Roll: 360° Pitch: 65° Yaw: 65°
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `SetMode(m)` | Set scanning mode (1: Trigger, 2: Continuous) |
| `Trigger()` | Manually trigger barcode reading when in trigger mode |
| `DVer()` | Check driver version |

products.name: Thermal
products.description: Capture 8x8 thermal images. Capable of measuring 0° to 80° celsius.
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `PixTemp(p)` | Read one of the `p` pixels' temp. There are 64 pixels (0 to 63). |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: Dio X12
products.description: Access the first 12 pins of the DUELink system on screw terminal block. These pins are digital inputs/outputs and most of them include analog, PWM and other functionalities.
products.driverApi:
:::tip
Dio X12 module uses the [Standard Library API](/docs/engine/stdlib) directly. No other drivers are needed.
:::

products.name: DueClick
products.description:
Take advantage of the thousands of available [MikroBus Click modules](https://www.mikroe.com/click).

The module can also be used as a basic female header IO connection module.

products.name: DuePi
products.description:
DuePi is the perfect adapter for all RPI (Raspberry Pi) models, including RPI Zero. The outer mounting holes are standard mounting holes for RPI. The bottom half of the board is a 5mm-pitched holes for mounting DUELink modules. This bottom side is breakable to make the board smaller to make it the right size for RPI Zero.

**DuePi with Raspberry Pi Zero**

![DuePi with Raspberry Pi Zero](/img/duepi-zero.png)

The board includes several onboard peripherals, including buttons, buzzer, and a graphical display. The display is controlled using the DUELink native Graphics support. Simple commands are used to control the display instead of using Linux.

The onboard 800mA regulator is used to feed power to the Downlink connector, keeping any loads away from the RPI's 3.3V source.

The USB connector is conveniently there to help with loading/updating the DUELink processor's firmware/drivers. It should not be used when DuePi is used with a Raspberry Pi.

:::note
With the USB connector and the onboard power regulator, this adapter can be used as a Microcomputer with full function
:::
keyFeatures: Attaches to Raspberry Pi or Pi Zero Header
products.driverApi:
| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `GetW()` | Get display width: 128. |
| `GetH()` | Get display height: 64. |
| `IsColor()` | Returns 0. |
| `BtnA()` | Returns 1 if button A is pressed. |
| `BtnB()` | Returns 1 if button B is pressed. |
| `Buzzer(f,d)` | Plays buzzer to `f` frequency(50 to 15K) for `d` duration in milliseconds. |
| `DVer()` | This driver version. |

products.name: DuePico
products.description:
DuePico is the perfect adapter for RPI (Raspberry Pi) Pico. It gracefully takes the RPI Pico on its back side and offers all RPI Pico connections on female headers, allowing to connect it as you wish.

![DuePico with Raspberry Pi Pico](/img/duepico-pico.png)

On the front side, the board includes several peripherals, including buttons, buzzer, and a graphical display. The display is controlled using the DUELink native [Graphics](/docs/engine/graphics) support. Simple commands are used to control the display instead of replying on RPI Pico.

The onboard 800mA regulator is used to feed power to the Downlink connector, keeping any loads away from the RPI Pico's 3.3V source.

The USB connector is conveniently there to help with loading/updating the DUELink processor's firmware/drivers. It should not be used when DuePico is used with a RPI Pico.

:::note
With the USB connector and the onboard power regulator, this adapter can be used as a Microcomputer with full functionality without the need of any RPI!
:::

products.name: Breakout
products.description:
This module can be used as a DUELink cable extender. It also exposes all DUELink cable signals on a female header. This is useful to wire a [Supported Hardware](/docs/hw/intro) that does not have a JST connector.

The DRP and CTN signals are a mix of [UART](/docs/interface/uart), [I2C](/docs/interface/i2c) and [USB](/docs/interface/usb) [Interfaces](/docs/interface/intro).

Here is a UART example:
![Arduino Breakout UART](pathname:///img/arduino-breakout-uart.png)

Here is an I2C example:
![Arduino Breakout I2C](pathname:///img/arduino-breakout-i2c.png)

products.name: LinkBit
products.description: Bring a standard DUELink Downlink to your BBC micro:bit.

products.name: Power Hook
products.description: The Power Hook works just like the USB Hook, but then it also includes a recharging circuit for 3.7V 10440 battery, which is required but not included. Note that the required 10440 battery is the same size as standard AAA batteries, but they are NOT compatible. NEVER install a AAA battery on this module!

products.name: Power Inject
products.description: When necessary, this module injects power in a long chain of DUELink modules. This also helps power any modules that have extra power needs than available on the main power source.
keyFeatures: USB Type C for Power Only

products.name: PullUp
products.description: If the I2C was chosen and the system does not have the proper I2C pull up resistors, then these PullUp modules come in very handy.

products.name: Power Switch
products.description: The power switch will disconnect power going to its downlink connector.

products.name: Sticker
products.description: This is the ideal combo for Stick Microcomputer. It exposes all pins, some on male and some on female headers. The male headers add power and ground in a standard servo pinout.

products.name: USB Hook
products.tagline: USB Interface Connection for DUELink Modules
products.description: USB Hook is handy to add USB Interface to any DUELink module. It includes an 800mA power source and a power LED.

products.name: USB Wedge
products.description: A PCB (Printed Circuit Board) USB wedge for connecting DUELink modules to the USB Interface. It includes a power LED and 800mA power regulator.

products.name: Wireless Hook
products.description: This module works just like the USB Hook, but then it also adds wireless connectivity, allowing for wireless control of DUELink modules.

products.name: Cable
products.description:
A variety of DUELink cable lengths are available to help projects of different needs.

Cable sets are available in:  
• 5x 50mm  
• 5x 150mm  
• 5x 300mm  
• 5x 100mm JST to pin header breakout  
• Variety Pack: 1x 300mm, 2x 150mm, 2x 50mm

products.name: Connector
products.description:
These standard connecters are here to help you in building [your own DUELink modules](/docs/catalog/third-party). This is a pack of 10 connectors.

:::note
These blue connectors will get discolored in a reflow oven. They are made for hand soldering. Contact us if you need a volume blue connectors that are suitable for reflow.
:::

products.name: Holey Board
products.tagline: Holey Boards for Mounting DUELink Modules
products.description:
Holey Boards are blank circuits with standard 5mm-pitched holes for mounting DUELink Module. See [Mounting Hardware](./axmnt) for options.

There are three size:
* Holey Smally Board: 18x12 holes
* Holey Board: 36x18 holes
* Holey Moley Board: 46x36 holes

products.name: Mounting HW
products.description:
Standoffs, Screws, Nuts, and Footpads are available to help in mounting all DUELink modules.

While you can use these options with 3D printed and laser cut enclosures, the ideal use with any of the [Holey Boards](./axholey)!

The available options are:
* 10x - Male to Female Nylon standoffs
* 10x - Female to Female Nylon standoffs
* 10x - M3 Nylon Screws
* 10x - M3 Nylon Nuts
* 4x - M3 Metal Footpads
